title: Was I really toxic?
body:
>playing game with lvl 13 friend, he just started playing league again
>just some normals
>I end up picking Talon mid, friend goes Jax top
>We load in and I see that there is another Talon mid
>We have the same skin and everything
>At the start of the match, the Talon boasts that he is "going to demolish me"
>End up killing him at Level 3
>Flash my Mastery 6 Emote every kill I get (not just on the Talon)
>End up snowballing and end up going 12/1/3 by the time we finish the game
>Talon says in the end game chat "Report your Talon for being Toxic'


I don't really see if I was toxic or not, I only spoke "GLHF!" at the start of the match and those were the only words that left my mouth that match. Was I considered toxic for flashing my emote every kill I got? I mean, isn't that what you use them for? Anyway, an answer is much appreciated!

replies.body:
If a feature such as the Emote wasn't meant to be abused than it would not have been added by Riot. A feature such as its self is always going to be used in every circumstance, and iv'e read others saying here that "depending on the circumstance it makes a difference, and doing it on every kill is BM".

Please give me an example when it is OK to use it than? Because as the metaphor goes when ever it is used it's like tea-bagging someone.

If anyone is actual toxic in sense it would be the other Talon cockiness and ego being crushed by yourself and that because he lost the match up that he can win by playing the victim card like so many people are doing. 

If your emotional state can't handle a digital flash emote designed to mock someone that you and everyone has access to use in any circumstance than please get off the internet. 

You did nothing wrong man, show that scrub talon who deserves the mastery.

Eh flash ur mastery emote whenever you want. If someone can't handle being shown an emote after being killed then perhaps they should go play My Little Pony. Get a grip, this is why this game is pathetic. People report one another at the drop of a dime regardless if it's a little bit of banter or fun. Hell even the pro's do it. It's all just a bit of fun and to get inside your opponents head without flaming them.

I don't use mastery emotes. I think they are stupid. So I'm playing someone I haven't played in a while on top of the fact I haven't played consistently in over a *year* and you're just gonna spam that emote in the 4v5 you're in whenever we get dumped on? 'K then bud.
no, but dont use this like 4chan its really annoying

Personally, I hate seeing people flash their mastery badge when they get a kill. I've even considered not going to the aid of my allies I've seen do it. It comes across really arrogant and I'm surprised Riot allowed it.

However, seeing people perform terrible tower dives, or just mess up terribly, and pop that mastery badge as they are dying makes me laugh every time.

Good with the bad, I guess.
---However because he totally bm'd at the start of the game this was totally justified.

'Toxic' is just another buzzword that people like to throw around to show how offended they are. 
You're certainly not on your way to getting an Honourable Opponent medal, but it's nothing to get so worked up about where you require a reform in behaviour... 

Whenever I see fit, I do the same, whether I made a good play, my opponent(s) made a bad play and I capitalised, or when I go running into the 87HP Varus as a recently dead Kog'Maw. Though I barely flash it more than a few times a game, and that's really all you should be doing, otherwise you will end up with people being a salty sobber where they can't do anything bar report you in the post-game lobby. 

Remember, show humility in victory, and grace in defeat.

> Flash my Mastery 6 Emote every kill I get

This right here is what's called "bad sportsmanship". It's no different than if you posted "ggez" in all chat every time you got a kill.

If you want to use your mastery emote that's fine, just don't do it to boast.
But isn't the point of the emote to 'reflect your mastery of the champion'? Getting a kill would just show that you have the skill needed for the champion.

Not necessarily. Getting a kill just means you got a kill, there are a wide variety of factors that would go into *how* you got that kill, and with the right circumstances anyone, regardless of skill, can get a kill.

"Emote flashing" on every kill is basically the LoL equivalent of tea-bagging on every kill in FPS games. It's bad sportsmanship to say the least, and outright rude as far as I'm concerned.

As I said, there's no issue with you using the emote, however the circumstances you use it in can make a world of difference.

For example, if you just started a game, got to lane and "traded" emotes with your lane opponent, there's no issue there. Using emotes (and not just mastery emotes) at that point in the game when nothing is (usually) happening is a pretty common behaviour and, in the vast majority of circumstances, isn't seen as rude or bad sportsmanship.

Next people will be saying building {{item:3512}} in a lane your winning is BM.

stop being so PC and fragile.

Bad mannered = BM. Meaning you use bad manners to annoy the opposition.

You didn't do anything wrong though so the crybaby talon you played against will just waste his time reporting you. Technically that makes him the toxic person because he becomes negative when playing computer games so you will be fine
Thta's the reason for the mastery emote, it's to BM, nothing more. I don't think you were toxic at all, i get rivens and yasuos that do it even without getting kills.
Fill me in on what 'BM' is..........
I don't think I can blame you islanders for being toxic; it's just a part of your peasant lifestyle.
